data.text: Finnair starts co-operation negotiations on plans to reduce 1 000 jobs due to COVID-19 impacts and travel restrictions. Long-term temporary layoffs will also continue for thousands of Finnair employees. https://t.co/NEZlJELPnD

We have finalised a sale and leaseback agreement for one of its A350 aircraft. The immediate positive cash effect for Finnair is in excess of 100 million euros. Read more: https://t.co/UuYaNxqegP https://t.co/sPsslvhpTC

data.text:
Did you know?
✈️ In Finland, travel adds €16 billion to the economy, which is more than the forestry industry
✈️With the multiplier effect, aviation adds 100,000 jobs to the Finnish economy
✈️The travel industry accounts for 2.6% of Finland’s GDP
https://t.co/0AYUeZVdcV

data.text: For many, a spa holiday is not the first thing that comes to mind when thinking about Lithuania, but did you know that Lithuania has an excellent spa town? Druskininkai is in the southern part of Lithuania, about 120 km from Vilnius. Read more: https://t.co/Gk28OWed5Q
RT @MantiVP: In #Finland you find 100% mask zone on flights & airports. Thrilled to fly again. Thanks @flynorra & @Finnair for a smooth rid…

We are flying to three different destinations in Lapland; Rovaniemi, Kittilä and Ivalo. The best chance to see northern lights is in Ivalo as it is the most north location. Northern lights are visible approximately 200 days a year in northern Lapland. https://t.co/w6QmxOFy9d

data.text:
Here's why airplanes are an unlikely place to catch viruses:
👉 HEPA filters remove 99.97% of bacteria and viruses
👉 The air in cabins is completely changed every 3-7 mins
👉 There is no air flow forward or rearward along the cabin
Read more: https://t.co/a82jfdRB2k
Put these places on your Copenhagen bucket list if you love Scandinavian interior design. https://t.co/zjAWXDtmVw

data.text: RT @rkalviainen: Flying for the first time for four months with @Finnair and everything went well, also at the airport I got several times…

In Q2, the COVID-19 pandemic almost halted our passenger traffic, and our result was heavily in the red. Over 70% of our revenue came from cargo. Now the rebuild phase has started, and we expect to fly ~50% of our normal amount of flights in September.

data.text: In our Airbus and Embraer aircraft, the air in the cabin is fresh air drawn from outside. That air gets sterilized by high temperatures in the pneumatic and air conditioning systems. The rest of the air is circulated through extremely efficient HEPA filters. #COVID19 #safety https://t.co/sA94VLx1SQ
